author: Adrian Andrews
title: Florida AG Moody sues the DOJ over its investigation into Trump's assassination attempt
text: Florida is suing the federal government over a Justice Department decision to block the state from investigating a second assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump. In a complaint filed Wednesday, Florida Attorney General Ashley Moody argued the state has a right to investigate given the attempt happened at Trump’s West Palm Beach golf course, located about 20 miles north of Mar-a-Lago. “It is very common for state investigators, state prosecutors, to work with our federal prosecutors and federal agencies, on dual tracks with different purposes," Moody said after Gov. Ron DeSantis signed an executive order on Sept. 17 to launch a state-level investigation. Moody’s lawsuit against Attorney General Merrick Garland stems around a federal law that she says bars Florida from getting involved in the Justice Department’s investigation. She alleges in her 18-page complaint that this violates the 10th Amendment, which protects state governments from federal overreach. "Almost immediately, however, federal officials began taking steps to halt the State's investigation," Moody wrote. “In conversations with federal officials and in subsequent correspondence, these officials have stated that Florida may not conduct its own investigation, may not interview witnesses, and may only cooperate with the federal government’s investigation." The Florida attorney is asking for a federal judge to rule the Justice Department’s actions as unconstitutional.

author: Nation World News Desk
title: Severe Blizzard Hits North Central United States
text: Cold weather continues, especially in the northern United States. A major winter storm system will affect areas of the north and center of the country this Wednesday. In view of this, as expected, this leaves serious problems for air and ground transportation. The National Weather Service (NWS) reported today that the system should weaken through the remainder of the week as it moves northeastward across the Central Plains. “This Wednesday the main band of snow is affecting parts of the northern plains to the centre, with light snowfall expected to subside.” “Thursday through Friday morning, a mix of rain and snow will move into the Midwest. It will then remain in the Midwest or even expand slightly as another system from the north will approach with low pressure,” the NWS explained. accidents under snow In Nebraska, the Highway Patrol responded to over a hundred incidents caused by weather conditions, the majority of which resulted in crashes without injuries. Its senior officials spread a message on the topic through the social network X, formerly Twitter. “Slow down, increase your safety distance, wear your seat belt and drive safely if you must be on the road at night. “Winter driving conditions exist across much of Nebraska.” The NWS also reports that freezing rain may occur in parts of northern and eastern South Dakota and southern and eastern North Dakota. The extended forecast indicates snow accumulations could range from 0.25 inches to double that. This will cause damage to trees and power outages. Experts predict that winter conditions will worsen across the country next January. Primarily, the most affected states, as is usually the case every year, will be the states located in the northern part of the country. (TagstoTranslate)alert

author: Las Vegas Aces
title: Las Vegas Aces Tiffany Hayes: How to Go from Retired to Sixth Player of the Year in 1 Easy Step
text:
Las Vegas Aces Tiffany Hayes: How to Go from Retired to Sixth Player of the Year in 1 Easy Step
September 5, 2024 -
Women's National Basketball Association (WNBA) Las Vegas Aces News Release
No team has won more games than the Aces since June 19, and no player is more responsible for that surge than leading Sixth Player of the Year candidate Tiffany Hayes.
Yes, A'ja Wilson has been a monster and prohibitive favorite for the 2024 M'VP Award all season long and by far the biggest part of Las Vegas' success, but she has been a consistent monster all season long. The X-factor that helped turn the Aces season around was their decision to reach out to the retired Hayes, and sign her on May 31.
Over Las Vegas last 21 games they are 15-6-again, the most wins in the WNBA over that stretch. Hayes is averaging 9.8 points per game during that span, while making 58.3 percent of her shots from the field and 43.5 percent of her shots from 3-point range. That is the highest field goal percentage of any player in the league averaging more than 3 shots per game, and the sixth highest 3-point field goal percentage of any player averaging more than 2 shots from beyond the arc.
Since July 14, the 5-10 guard has been even hotter averaging 12.4 points while making 62.8 percent of her shots from the field and 50.0 percent from distance. Chicago's 6-7 center Kamilla Cardoso is the only player making a higher percentage of her shots since that date, and only 3 players averaging more than 2 shots from distance are connecting on a higher percentage than Hayes.
For the season, Hayes is averaging 8.8 points per game as a reserve which leads the WNBA among players who are eligible for the Sixth Player of the Year award and qualified for statistical rankings. Her 51.1 percent shooting from the field is second behind 6-7 Dallas center Kalani Brown among all eligible players who have taken at least 3 shots per game.
Hayes individual offensive efficiency rating of 120 is just behind A'ja Wilson's 122, and her 2.4 win shares are the third most on the Aces team.
And to think she was retired just over 3 months ago.

author: Dil Bar Irshad
title: PM Modi Inaugurates Se La Tunnel, Bolsters India's Defense in Tawang Against China
text:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi has marked a significant milestone in India's border infrastructure and defense capabilities with the inauguration of the
Se La Tunnel in Arunachal Pradesh. This event is not just a triumph of engineering but a strategic move to ensure faster troop deployment in the Tawang sector, a region of historical conflict and strategic interest with China. The tunnel, part of the broader 'Viksit Bharat Viksit North East' initiative, underscores India's resolve to maintain a formidable defense posture along its borders.
Strategic Importance and Historical Context
The inauguration of the nearly 2.5 kilometer long tunnel under the 4,190 meter high Se La pass is a critical development in India's defense strategy against potential Chinese aggression. This move is particularly poignant considering the historical significance of Se La and Tawang during the 1962 India-China war, where India faced setbacks due to infrastructural and leadership constraints. Today, the completion of the Se La tunnel, alongside the Nechiphu tunnel, represents a significant leap in ensuring all-weather connectivity and rapid mobilization capabilities in one of the most contested regions along the India-China border.
Engineering Marvel and Developmental Leap
Constructed at an altitude of 13,700 feet and costing 825 crore, the Se La tunnel stands as the world's longest twin-lane tunnel at such a high altitude. Built by the Border Roads Organisation (BRO) using the new Austrian Tunnelling Method, the tunnel is an engineering marvel, designed to provide all-weather connectivity between Tezpur and Tawang, significantly reducing travel time and avoiding the treacherous snow-covered Sela pass. This project not only has profound implications for military strategy but also promises to boost tourism and economic development in the region, illustrating a dual-use approach to infrastructure development in border areas.
Future Implications and Strategic Outlook
The timely completion of the Se La tunnel, within five years of laying the foundation stone, is a testament to India's commitment to strengthening its border infrastructure, a move that is seen as vital in the face of ongoing tensions with China. With the Chinese military's historical infrastructure advancements in the region, India's focus on enhancing its border roads and tunnels is a clear indication of its strategic intent to ensure preparedness and deterrence. This development also reflects a broader shift in India's defense strategy, prioritizing mobility, rapid deployment capabilities, and resilience in facing contemporary security challenges.
The inauguration of the
Se La tunnel by Prime Minister Narendra Modi is not just a significant achievement in terms of infrastructure and defense. It symbolizes a new era of Indian assertiveness and strategic foresight in border areas, particularly in the face of adversarial pressures. As India continues to bolster its defense infrastructure, the Se La tunnel will serve as a critical asset in ensuring the nation's sovereignty and security in the strategically vital Tawang sector, reinforcing India's position and readiness on the global stage.

author: www.yunnan.cn,云南日报报业集团,云南网
title: 云南省发出全民义务植树尽责倡议　植绿护绿爱绿 共赴青山之约_云南看点_社会频道_云南网
text:
云南网讯（记者 王丹） 今年3月12日是我国第47个植树节，我省向社会各界发出倡议：以“履行义务植树 共建美丽中国”为使命，凝聚每一份力量，让义务植树成为全民行动自觉，让云南的绿水青山焕发时代新颜。
做绿水青山的忠诚守护者，以“十年树木百年心”的坚守呵护每一片绿意。森林和绿地是大自然赋予的宝贵财富，要像爱护自己的眼睛一样爱护它们，尊重自然、顺应自然、保护自然。爱护每一棵树木，不随意践踏草坪、攀折花木，不侵占绿地林地。增强森林防火意识，严格遵守防火规定，举报盗伐滥伐违法行为，用法治力量筑牢生态屏障，共同守护绿色家园，让生态文明理念深深扎根在每个人心中。
做植树造林的躬身实践者，以“携手并肩业可成”的担当播种绿色希望。通过多种形式履行植树义务，走进山林田野，种下希望的树苗，体验植树的乐趣。通过“互联网+全民义务植树”平台，选择认种认养、捐资、参与抚育管护和自然保护、设施修建、志愿服务等尽责形式，为绿化事业贡献力量。在6月“云南植树月”前后，可积极参加义务植树活动，自觉完成“每人每年3至5棵”的植树目标，让义务植树成为新时代公民的绿色勋章。
做生态文明的积极传播者，以“一树新栽益四邻”的情怀传递绿色能量。积极创作植树主题短视频，分享家庭园艺经验等，通过各种渠道和方式，大力宣传全民义务植树的重要意义，传播植绿护绿、爱护环境、善待自然的生态文明理念。带动身边的家人、朋友，加入到植树护绿的队伍中来，营造人人参与、共建共享的良好氛围，让“植绿护绿爱绿”成为新时代的社会风尚。
共赴青山之约，同筑美丽云南。自2024年以来，我省完成义务植树9943万株、营造林349.9万亩、种草改良26.2万亩；完成特色乡土树种保障性苗圃基地建设三年行动，19个省级保障性苗圃基地育苗4542万株；审认定林木良种90个、草品种18个，主要造林树种良种使用率达76.9%。同时，我省建立11个主要树种生物量模型及有关碳计量参数，系统测算全省森林碳储量达11.7亿吨、年碳汇量近8400万吨；承办全国林业碳汇试点研讨会，深化国家林业碳汇试点，启动省级林业碳汇试点，实现林业碳普惠交易159万元，发放林业碳汇质押贷款1800万元。
今年，全省林草系统将聚焦科学推进国土绿化，积极争取国家国土绿化示范、“双重”等项目支持，启动省级国土绿化示范项目，强化落地上图精细管理，创新抓实全民义务植树活动，持续推进干热河谷、石漠化等区域生态修复，完成营造林200万亩以上；巩固拓展森林城市和森林乡村建设成果，综合选取重点州市强化技术和项目支持，以点带面深化美丽云南建设。此外，我省还将制定森林碳汇计量监测规范，深化碳汇试点工作；建立林业碳汇项目库，探索推进林业碳汇项目开发和短周期交易工作。
新闻链接
5个义务植树尽责接待点
●昆明市海口林场省级爱国主义教育基地
●瑞丽市姐勒水库水源涵养林
●景洪市傣王宫遗址周边及其澜沧江右岸
●勐海县景海公路（景洪至勐海段）和勐遮公路（勐海至勐遮段）
●勐腊县第一小学
2种义务植树预约方式
预约方式1：微信关注“全民义务植树”公众号—尽责参与—劳动尽责/捐资尽责—选择适合的项目—我要参与—网上报名。
预约方式2：登录云南全民义务植树网（//www.yiwuzhishu.cn/）—参与尽责—选择适合的项目—我要参与—手机微信扫码报名。

author: Ansa Agenzia
title: Ghf, 'attaccati da Hamas, uccisi 5 nostri operatori umanitari'
text:
(ANSA) - WASHINGTON, 12 GIU - La Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, organizzazione privata sostenuta dagli Stati Uniti e attiva nella Striscia di Gaza, accusa Hamas di aver attaccato un autobus che trasportava i suoi operatori umanitari, causando almeno cinque morti e numerosi feriti. Lo ha reso noto la stessa fondazione in un comunicato. L'attacco sarebbe avvenuto intorno alle 22:00 ora locale di ieri, mentre il mezzo si dirigeva verso un centro di distribuzione di aiuti nell'area ovest di Khan Younis. A bordo c'erano oltre venti membri del team, tutti cittadini palestinesi impiegati come operatori umanitari. "Condanniamo con la massima fermezza questo attacco brutale e deliberato - si legge nella nota -. Queste erano persone che rischiavano la propria vita ogni giorno per aiutare gli altri: padri, fratelli, figli e amici." La Ghf ha aggiunto che alcune delle persone a bordo potrebbero essere state prese in ostaggio, anche se al momento le informazioni restano frammentarie. Attiva dal 26 maggio, dopo oltre due mesi di completo blocco degli aiuti da parte israeliana, la fondazione ha dichiarato di aver già distribuito oltre sette milioni di pasti. (ANSA).
'Colpito un autobus, a bordo 20 addetti che portavano aiuti'
Giovedì 12 Giugno 2025, 08:55

author: , The Arizona Republic
title: Northern lights visible in central Arizona
text: Northern lights visible in central Arizona The northern lights were visible in some parts of central Arizona on Thursday night. According to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's [Space Weather Prediction Center](https://www.swpc.noaa.gov/news/g4-severe-storm-watch-10-11-october), solar material and magnetic fields erupted and created a coronal mass ejection Oct. 8. This resulted in a geomagnetic storm that arrived at Earth on Thursday and caused the aurora borealis to be visible in some parts of North America. Although NOAA forecast the aurora would be visible Thursday night as far south as northern Utah, some Arizonans away from light pollution could catch a glimpse. People who missed the northern lights Thursday could have a second chance to see them Friday night. "The aurora does not need to be directly overhead but can be observed from as much as 1000 km away when the aurora is bright and if conditions are right," according to NOAA statement. NOAA offers an [aurora forecast online.](https://www.swpc.noaa.gov/communities/aurora-dashboard-experimental) Will Arizona see northern lights in 2025 [Here's what experts say and how to watch](https://www.azcentral.com/story/news/local/arizona/2024/10/04/northern-lights-arizona-2025/75494995007/)

author: Forecast Centre
title: Heavy snow, ice and rain make a mess of the weekend in parts of Atlantic Canada - The Weather Network
text: Brace for a wild weather weekend as an impactful system barrels towards the Maritimes, threatening to disrupt travel with freezing rain, heavy snowfall, and the risk of localized flooding The official arrival of spring has felt like anything but across much of Eastern Canada this week, with rounds of wintry weather bringing strong winds and heavy snow. The first full weekend of spring will feature much of the same, as 40+ cm of snow targets parts of New Brunswick, while soaking rains span Nova Scotia. There's also a widespread risk for freezing rain and ice accretion in some spots. MUST SEE: Rare widespread chill to hit Canada, kicking off an active pattern Travel conditions will likely be jeopardized, so drivers are urged to plan ahead, and stay aware of your local road conditions before heading out. Saturday into Sunday: Heavy snow and rain spread across the Maritimes A low pressure system will strengthen as it heads towards the Bay of Fundy, scooping up subtropical moisture along the way. The system begins with snowfall, spreading from west to east, across the Maritimes on Saturday. For northern and central New Brunswick, the precipitation will remain as mostly heavy snow, with as much as 40 cm possible in the hardest hit places. Widespread special weather statements are in effect for the province. Through the overnight hours on Saturday, there is the chance for some mixing and ice accretion south of Fredericton and north of Saint John . Exact totals for icing are uncertain as this time, as the track in the system could have an impact on precipitation types. The precipitation will change back to snow before gradually easing off through Sunday. Drivers are being urged to plan ahead, and to adapt to the changing and rapidly deteriorating conditions. The heavy, wet snow and icy conditions could also heighten the risk for power outages . Across Nova Scotia, the primary threat with this system will be heavy rain, with the risk for localized flooding in some of the heaviest hit areas. The rain will intensify through Sunday morning, with a brief period of mixed precipitation likely as the front slides out of the Maritimes. By Sunday evening, most of the moisture will be confined to the southern coast of Nova Scotia, with between 30-50 mm of rain forecast through the weekend. A couple more systems will bring unsettled weather for the second half of next week and into the weekend, with primarily rain and above seasonal temperatures forecast across the region. Stay tuned to The Weather Network for the latest forecast updates for Eastern Canada.

author: Field Level Media
title: Report: Byron Leftwich joining Colorado coaching staff - NewsBreak
text: Former NFL quarterback and offensive coordinator Byron Leftwich is joining the coaching staff under Deion Sanders at Colorado, Jordan Schultz of Fox Sports reported Wednesday. The reports come a day after Leftwich was spotted at practice holding a clipboard and wearing Colorado football gear. Sanders said on Monday Colorado would make "a couple more huge moves" this week but has not confirmed Leftwich's hiring. It's unclear what Leftwich's role will be on Sanders' staff. Leftwich interviewed with the New England Patriots for their head coaching post in January. Leftwich, 45, most recently worked as the offensive coordinator for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers from 2019-22, a stint that included a Super Bowl win in the 2020 season. Leftwich was fired by Bucs head coach Todd Bowles after the 2022 season, which saw Tampa Bay slip from the top 3 in scoring the previous three seasons to No. 15 in yards and No. 25 in points in 2022. A quarterback and first-round pick by the Jacksonville Jaguars in the 2003 NFL Draft, Leftwich had a 24-26 record with 10,532 passing yards and 58 touchdowns in 60 games with the Jaguars (2003-06), Atlanta Falcons (2007), Bucs (2009) and Steelers (2008, 2010, 2012). He also worked in various roles including the interim offensive coordinator for the Arizona Cardinals from 2016-2018. --Field Level Media Subscribe to The Rogersville Review
